alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:02PM EDT until June 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT/245 PM CDT/ FOR EAST CENTRAL JACKSON...NORTHWESTERN GADSDEN... SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR AND SOUTHEASTERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 301 PM EDT/201 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Chattahoochee, or 20 miles south of Donalsonville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge, Seminole State Park, Reynoldsville, Mount Pleasant, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, Recovery, Faceville, Hardaway, Drakes Still, Jinks, Fairchild, River Junction and Lake Seminole. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
